introduction: I am a software developer based in Manila, Philippines. I have an appetite for learning and a passion for creating software applications that do stuff. When 'm not in front of a computer you'll find me tinkering with hobby electronics or just chillin' beside a cat.
manifesto: IMHO, computer programming is a discipline of both Science and Art mungled together in perfect harmony. Creating a good software application is more than that though, It's a mixture of technical excellence, domain knowledge, complementary UI/UX and two-way communication between the client and developer - I always strive to deliver all.

history.title: Nokia Networks UICA (R&D Engineer I)
texts: Two months after earning my BS in Computer Engineering from Technological Institue of the Philippines, I started working at Nokia as an R&D Engineer I.

I was part of a team responsible for developing and maintaining features of a monolithic user-interface software for base transceiver stations using Java technologies. This is where I started to really have that initial foundation for Software Development. Thanks to my highly competent colleagues and seniors at that time, I learned the ropes - bridged the gap between school and actual industry experience. Discovered agile, clean code, the benefits of Test-Driven development, best practices and many more. I'm very fortunate to have worked here for my 1st Job.

history.title: Nokia A&T Preventive Platforms (R&D Engineer II)
texts: Technically my second job, but still with the folks at Nokia working as a Software Specialist that develops and maintains tools and softwares that support the Architecture and Technology Preventive Platforms.

I was a key person responsible for the system architecture design and implementation of various software systems. I had spent enormous amount of time prototyping designing architectures that would fit the requirements. I had tons of fun learning and really immersed myself in the world of good design, refactoring disciplines, SOLID principles and design patterns.

Aside from developing software, I also participated on tons of internal hackathons such as: StraTWOs, VR and IoT. Joined university CodeRetreats as a Facilitator where we visit various universities to provide real-word insights and hopefully imparted inspiration to students that will soon enter the Software industry.

history.title: Vertere Global Solutions, Inc. (Programmer Analyst III - Team Lead)
texts: Was part of a team that was deployed at Sydney, Australia to oversee and implement the transition of an entire business listing and searching software application product.

Worked on Java Spring microservices on the backend and AngularJS on the front-end. I'm used to Jenkins - even led DevOps initiative during my time at Nokia A&T but this is the first time that I had the chance to work on a bunch of new (at least for me) CI/CD and cloud delivery services such as Bamboo, Ansible and AWS.

history.title: Accenture, Sensis (Application Developer Team Lead)
texts: Worked on pretty much the same set of technologies back at my previous job. This time, we're maintaining and developing features for a Content Management system that is being consumed by a business listing and searching web application.
